com.mycompany.eurostat

Class ApiHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mycompany.eurostat.ApiHelper

  • public class ApiHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Engine that corrects the broken API of Eurostat, and correctly retrieves categorised research results. see API web page for context @see here. the order of research results present in the field 'value' is dictated by the following ranking logic: o = 35i + s Where 'o' represents the research outcome for a specific state in response to a particular research question, 'i' corresponds to the index of the current research question, and 's' represents the index of the current state

      Constructor and Description
      ApiHelper()

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.math.BigDecimal> convertToCorrectList(JSONObject researchResultsApiJson, JSONObject indicatorLabelsList, int currentStateIndex)
      All unknown research results have the value '0' for the percentage.

    • Method Detail

      • convertToCorrectList

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.math.BigDecimal> convertToCorrectList(JSONObject researchResultsApiJson,
                                                                                            JSONObject indicatorLabelsList,
                                                                                            int currentStateIndex)
        All unknown research results have the value '0' for the percentage. when this value is inserted into this programs' BarChart, it visually represents an unknown research result, instead of a research result of 0%.
        Parameters:
        researchResultsApiJson - the JSONObject containing the corrupted list of research results
        indicatorLabelsList - the JSONObject containing a list of all indicators (research questions)
        currentStateIndex - the int that represents the index for the current state
        Returns:
        a corrected HashMap containg all research results, in the form of a 'research question | outcome percentage' key-value pair
